claim: neither team score for only the first game of the world cup in france
resp:
Here's the reasoning process:

1. Identify all the games played during the World Cup in France (from Row 11 to Row 14). This can be done by checking the 'comp' column for matches with "world cup".
2. Check if any of these games have a score of 0-0. If so, it means neither team scored in that game.
3. Inspect each of the identified games (from Row 11 to Row 14) to see if there's a score other than 0-0 for any of them.

Based on the provided table:

- Row 11 has a score of 0-0, indicating neither team scored.
- Row 12 has a score of 0-0, indicating neither team scored.
- Row 13 has a score of 1-3, indicating one team scored but not the other.
- Row 14 has a score of 0-0 (1-0 aet), which means that at full time neither team scored, but in extra time one team did score.

Since both games where the competition is "world cup" have a score of 0-0 at full time, it implies that neither team scores only for the first game of the world cup in France (which is Row 11 and Row 12).
